detailed_description: A plugin for Grasshopper (Rhino) that integrates Gmsh for meshing and Calculix for Finite Element Analysis, enabling a parametric simulation workflow within the CAD environment.

name: StressTopOpt
one_line_profile: Efficient 3D sensitivity analysis code for stress-based topology optimization
detailed_description: A compact MATLAB implementation for stress-based topology optimization, providing an efficient 3D sensitivity analysis solver often used as a reference or baseline in topology optimization research.

name: PtFEM.jl
one_line_profile: Julia implementation of 'Programming the Finite Element Method' library
detailed_description: A Julia package implementing the finite element methods and algorithms described in the textbook 'Programming the Finite Element Method' by Smith, Griffiths, and Margetts, serving as an educational and functional FEM library.

name: PDLSM-FEM_mpi
one_line_profile: Parallel coupled Peridynamics and FEM solver
detailed_description: A parallel C++ solver implementing adaptively coupled Peridynamics Least Squares Minimization (PDLSM) and Finite Element Method (FEM) for 2D and 3D structural analysis, supporting MPI parallelism.

name: FEM2D
one_line_profile: MATLAB code for 2D Finite Element Method
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Finite Element Method (FEM) for 2D problems, serving as a lightweight solver for educational or basic research purposes.

name: xpfem
one_line_profile: Python package for Finite Element Method in solid mechanics
detailed_description: A Python library for performing Finite Element Method (FEM) simulations specifically tailored for solid mechanics problems.

name: RBniCS
one_line_profile: Reduced Order Modelling in FEniCS
detailed_description: An implementation of reduced order modelling (ROM) techniques (such as the reduced basis method) within the FEniCS finite element framework, enabling efficient simulation of parametrized PDEs.

name: redback
one_line_profile: Rock Mechanics with Dissipative Feedbacks (MOOSE module)
detailed_description: A module built on the MOOSE framework for simulating rock mechanics with dissipative feedbacks, designed for coupled multi-physics simulations in geomechanics.

name: torch-diffsim
one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator in PyTorch
detailed_description: A minimal, parallelizable physics simulator written entirely in PyTorch, supporting automatic differentiation for physics-based learning and optimization tasks.

name: SCI-Solver_FEM
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated FEM linear system solver
detailed_description: A C++/CUDA library developed by the SCI Institute for solving Finite Element Method (FEM) linear systems efficiently using GPU hardware acceleration.

name: SIMO-Package
one_line_profile: NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) package
detailed_description: A MATLAB package implementing NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) for educational and research purposes in computational mechanics.

name: SciBlend
one_line_profile: Scientific data visualization workflows in Blender
detailed_description: A tool enabling advanced scientific data visualization workflows within Blender, allowing researchers to render high-quality visualizations of simulation and experimental data.

name: FractionalDiffEq.jl
one_line_profile: Fractional Differential Equation solver in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia package for solving Fractional Differential Equations (FDEs) using high-performance numerical methods.

name: FEniCS.jl
one_line_profile: Julia wrapper for the FEniCS Finite Element library
detailed_description: A Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) wrapper that provides an interface to the FEniCS Finite Element library within the Julia programming language.

name: HighDimPDE.jl
one_line_profile: Solver for high-dimensional PDEs using Deep BSDE methods
detailed_description: A Julia package implementing Deep Backwards Stochastic Differential Equation (Deep BSDE) and Feynman-Kac methods to solve high-dimensional Partial Differential Equations, overcoming the curse of dimensionality.

name: MethodOfLines.jl
one_line_profile: Automatic Finite Difference PDE solver for Julia SciML
detailed_description: A Julia package that automates the solution of Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using the Method of Lines (MOL) via finite difference discretizations, integrated with the SciML ecosystem.

name: NeuralPDE.jl
one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) solver
detailed_description: A comprehensive library for solving Partial Differential Equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other scientific machine learning methods, part of the Julia SciML ecosystem.

name: sedfoam
one_line_profile: Two-phase flow sediment transport solver for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A specialized solver for the OpenFOAM toolbox designed to simulate two-phase flow sediment transport processes.

name: Sectrics
one_line_profile: Truss analysis software using Finite Element Method
detailed_description: A software application written in C# for analyzing truss structures using the Finite Element Method (FEM).

name: XFEM_Fracture2D
one_line_profile: MATLAB XFEM solver for 2D fracture propagation
detailed_description: A MATLAB program for solving fracture problems involving arbitrary multiple crack propagations in 2D linear-elastic solids using the Extended Finite Element Method (XFEM).

name: SBFEM-UEL
one_line_profile: Abaqus user element for Scaled Boundary Finite Element Method
detailed_description: An implementation of a polyhedral user element (UEL) for ABAQUS based on the Scaled Boundary Finite Element Method (SBFEM), enabling SBFEM capabilities within commercial FEA software.

name: RapidCFD
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated OpenFOAM fork
detailed_description: A fork of OpenFOAM designed to run fully on CUDA platforms, providing GPU acceleration for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations.

name: fastNLfea
one_line_profile: Fast nonlinear FEA for topology optimization
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based fast nonlinear Finite Element Analysis (FEA) solver specifically tailored for topology optimization applications.

name: SlicerCBM
one_line_profile: Computational Biophysics for Medicine extension for 3D Slicer
detailed_description: An extension for the 3D Slicer platform that provides tools for computational biophysics and medical simulation, enabling biomechanical modeling directly within the medical imaging environment.

name: JAX-CPFEM
one_line_profile: Differentiable Crystal Plasticity FEM using JAX
detailed_description: An efficient, GPU-accelerated simulation tool for differentiable Crystal Plasticity Finite Element Method (CPFEM) implemented using JAX, suitable for materials science research.

name: Swan
one_line_profile: Topology Optimization Laboratory in MATLAB
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for topology optimization, providing a collection of methods and solvers for structural optimization research.

name: varFEM
one_line_profile: MATLAB Finite Element Method library
detailed_description: A MATLAB package providing finite element method implementations, serving as a functional library for educational and research applications in computational mechanics.

name: MetaOpenFOAM
one_line_profile: LLM-based multi-agent framework for OpenFOAM CFD
detailed_description: A multi-agent framework leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate and control OpenFOAM CFD simulations, facilitating natural language interaction with CFD workflows.

name: SCEMa
one_line_profile: Coupled FE-MD solver using Deal.II and LAMMPS
detailed_description: A Heterogeneous Multiscale Method (HMM) implementation that couples the Deal.II finite element library with the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator for multiscale material simulations.

name: TopologyOptimizationToolbox
one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for 3D structural topology optimization using unstructured meshes
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolbox designed for performing 3D structural topology optimization. It utilizes unstructured meshes to solve optimization problems, suitable for engineering design and structural analysis.

name: WENOEXT
one_line_profile: WENO scheme library extension for OpenFOAM framework
detailed_description: A C++ library that implements Weighted Essentially Non-Oscillatory (WENO) schemes within the OpenFOAM framework. It enhances OpenFOAM's capability to handle high-speed compressible flows with shock waves by providing high-order numerical schemes.

name: FEMAddOns
one_line_profile: Finite Element Method extensions for Wolfram Language
detailed_description: A collection of packages and functions that extend the Finite Element Method (FEM) capabilities of the Wolfram Language (Mathematica). It provides additional utilities for mesh generation, boundary condition handling, and post-processing for FEM analysis.

name: SPHinXsys
one_line_profile: Multi-physics simulation library based on Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics
detailed_description: A C++ library for engineering simulation and optimization using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It provides a unified framework for modeling complex systems involving fluid dynamics, solid mechanics, and fluid-structure interactions (FSI).

name: IGA-Contact
one_line_profile: Isogeometric analysis code for 2D statics and contact problems
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based finite element code implementing Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) for 2D static structural analysis and contact mechanics. It utilizes NURBS basis functions and the Penalty method for handling contact constraints.

name: Lattice-Boltzmann-Method-GPU
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 3D Lattice Boltzmann CFD solver
detailed_description: A high-performance Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver based on the Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM), optimized for NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA. It simulates steady and unsteady 3D single-phase flows with significantly higher speed compared to serial CPU implementations.

name: intansv
one_line_profile: Integrative analysis tool for structural variations in genomics
detailed_description: An R package for the integrative analysis of structural variations (SVs) in genomic data. It facilitates the reading, annotation, and visualization of SVs predicted by various tools, supporting bioinformatics research.

name: diffsim
one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator for learning and control
detailed_description: A scalable differentiable physics engine designed for integrating physics simulation with machine learning and control tasks. It allows for gradient-based optimization of physical parameters and control policies.

name: ASIGA
one_line_profile: Acoustic scattering solver using Isogeometric Analysis
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based software tool for simulating acoustic scattering problems using Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It leverages NURBS-based geometries for accurate wave propagation modeling.

name: MOOSE
one_line_profile: LLM-based framework for automated scientific hypothesis discovery
detailed_description: A framework leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate the discovery of open-domain scientific hypotheses. It assists researchers in generating and refining research ideas based on existing literature and data.

name: MOOSE-Chem
one_line_profile: LLM framework for rediscovering chemistry hypotheses
detailed_description: A specialized version of the MOOSE framework tailored for chemistry. It uses Large Language Models to rediscover and generate scientific hypotheses specifically within the chemical sciences domain.

name: pyMOTO
one_line_profile: Modular Python framework for topology optimization
detailed_description: A modular and flexible Python framework designed for topology optimization. It allows users to construct optimization workflows using a block-based approach, facilitating research and development in structural design.

name: trusspy
one_line_profile: Nonlinear truss solver for structural mechanics
detailed_description: A Python package for the nonlinear finite element analysis of truss structures. It supports geometric nonlinearities and provides tools for solving and visualizing truss deformations and forces.

name: IncompressibleNavierStokes.jl
one_line_profile: Incompressible Navier-Stokes solver in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia-based solver for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. It leverages Julia's performance capabilities to provide efficient fluid dynamics simulations.

name: stat-fem
one_line_profile: Statistical finite element method tools for data-constrained problems
detailed_description: A Python library developed by the Alan Turing Institute for solving data-constrained finite element problems. It integrates statistical methods with FEM to quantify uncertainty and incorporate observational data into physical models.

name: jaxsim
one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library
detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library written in JAX. It is designed for control and robot learning applications, enabling gradient-based optimization through physical simulations.

name: pydens
one_line_profile: Neural network framework for solving ODEs and PDEs
detailed_description: A Python framework for solving Ordinary and Partial Differential Equations (ODEs & PDEs) using neural networks. It simplifies the implementation of physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) and related deep learning-based solvers.

name: emopt
one_line_profile: Optimization suite for electromagnetic structures
detailed_description: A suite of tools for optimizing the shape and topology of electromagnetic structures. It combines Maxwell's equations solvers with gradient-based optimization algorithms for photonics and RF design.

name: moltres
one_line_profile: Molten Salt Reactor simulation code
detailed_description: A simulation code designed for modeling Molten Salt Reactors (MSRs). It solves coupled equations for neutronics and thermal-hydraulics relevant to MSR physics.

name: PythonFOAM
one_line_profile: In-situ data analysis and ML integration for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A tool developed by Argonne National Laboratory that enables in-situ data analysis and machine learning integration with OpenFOAM. It allows Python scripts to interact with OpenFOAM simulations at runtime.

name: TensorFlowFoam
one_line_profile: TensorFlow C-API integration for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: A library that integrates the TensorFlow C-API into OpenFOAM, enabling data-driven CFD algorithms. It allows researchers to embed trained neural networks directly into fluid dynamics solvers for turbulence modeling or flow control.

name: Coupling_ABAQUS_MATLAB
one_line_profile: Framework for Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) coupling between Abaqus and MATLAB
detailed_description: A framework enabling the execution of Finite Element (FE) packages like Abaqus inside an online loop with MATLAB. It facilitates Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) simulations for structural design, multi-physical simulations, and control theory applications by using compiled FORTRAN subroutines as messengers.

name: Apollo
one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for 3D electromagnetics simulation using MFEM
detailed_description: Apollo is a MOOSE-based application designed to enable 3D electromagnetics simulations. It leverages the MFEM finite element library to solve electromagnetic problems within the MOOSE framework ecosystem.

name: torch-fenics
one_line_profile: Interface coupling PyTorch with FEniCS for differentiable physics
detailed_description: A library that provides an interface between PyTorch and FEniCS, enabling the integration of finite element simulations into machine learning pipelines. It allows for differentiable physics simulations and solving inverse problems using automatic differentiation.

name: pinnfactory
one_line_profile: Lightweight framework for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)
detailed_description: A framework for building Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) with symbolic PDE definitions using SymPy and PyTorch. It supports flexible neural architectures, inverse parameter estimation, and automatic loss generation from PDEs and boundary conditions.

name: FBG-SimPlus
one_line_profile: Simulation tool for Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors using FEM
detailed_description: A simulation tool for Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors based on Finite Element Method (FEM) models. It allows users to simulate reflection spectrums of FBG sensor arrays in response to stress, strain, and temperature, including temperature dependency emulation.

name: CFDWARP
one_line_profile: CFD solver for waves, reactions, and plasmas
detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver designed for handling waves, chemical reactions, and plasmas. It provides capabilities for simulating complex fluid dynamics problems involving multi-physics phenomena.

name: pyspa
one_line_profile: Structural Path Analysis tool for input-output and process data
detailed_description: A Python package for conducting Structural Path Analysis (SPA) on square technological matrices of process or input-output data. It supports analysis using environmental, social, and financial satellites, typically used in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) and Industrial Ecology.

name: BreakSeq2
one_line_profile: Ultrafast nucleotide-resolution analysis of structural variants

name: Isogeometric-BEM
one_line_profile: MATLAB code for Isogeometric Boundary Element Analysis
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation for Isogeometric Boundary Element Method (IGABEM) analysis. It provides tools for performing boundary element analysis using isogeometric concepts, suitable for research and educational purposes in computational mechanics.

name: FLOWVPM.jl
one_line_profile: Meshless large eddy simulation using reformulated vortex particle method
detailed_description: A Julia package for meshless Large Eddy Simulation (LES) using the reformulated Vortex Particle Method (VPM). It is designed for high-fidelity fluid dynamics simulations without the need for traditional mesh generation.

name: pyiga
one_line_profile: Python research toolbox for Isogeometric Analysis
detailed_description: A Python-based research toolbox dedicated to Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It provides functionalities for implementing and testing IGA methods, suitable for computational mechanics research.

name: Cubit-CalculiX
one_line_profile: Coreform Cubit component for CalculiX pre- and post-processing
detailed_description: A component for Coreform Cubit that enables pre- and post-processing for the CalculiX solver. It facilitates the conversion of results to ParaView formats and integrates CalculiX workflows into the Cubit environment.

name: beso
one_line_profile: Topology optimization tool using CalculiX FEM solver

name: CalculiX Advanced Environment (CAE)

detailed_description: A tool to convert meshes from Salome's universal format (UNV) to the CalculiX input format (INP), enabling the use of Salome as a pre-processor for CalculiX.

name: IGAPack

detailed_description: A MATLAB library for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) that supports hierarchical refinements, providing tools for advanced computational mechanics research.

name: isogeometric-analysis

detailed_description: A MATLAB codebase implementing Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) and Finite Element Method (FEM) algorithms, suitable for research and development in numerical analysis.

name: rodin
one_line_profile: Modern C++20 finite element method and shape optimization framework
detailed_description: A lightweight, modular, and extensible C++20 framework for finite element analysis and shape optimization, focusing on clean architecture and modern language features.

name: TrioCFD

detailed_description: An open-source CFD code developed by CEA, featuring Front-Tracking, Radiation, ALE for fluid-structure interactions, and Turbulence LES & RANS models.

name: FEMM

name: CAN-PINN

detailed_description: Implementation of a Coupled-Automatic-Numerical differentiation scheme for physics-informed neural networks (PINN) to improve training efficiency and accuracy.

name: cfd3d

detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver implementing the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations in three dimensions.

name: cideMOD

detailed_description: A tool for solving DFN physicochemical equations for battery simulations using Finite Element methods, supporting thermal and degradation models.

name: biome

detailed_description: An experimental implementation of BioPerl functionalities using the Moose object system for bioinformatics data processing.

name: dflo

detailed_description: A C++ solver implementing the Discontinuous Galerkin method for simulating compressible fluid flows.

name: SmoothParticleNets

name: Foam-Agent

name: fusionforce

name: teseo

detailed_description: A C++ library designed for the analysis of structural dynamic graphs, developed by CWI.

name: PetIGA

name: igakit

name: classy_blocks

detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the creation of OpenFOAM's blockMesh dictionaries, enabling programmatic mesh generation.

name: evoxels

detailed_description: A differentiable physics framework designed for simulating voxel-based microstructures, enabling gradient-based optimization of material properties.

name: tIGAr
one_line_profile: Isogeometric analysis library using FEniCS
detailed_description: A Python library that enables Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) within the FEniCS finite element framework.

name: PyBSASeq

detailed_description: A tool implementing a novel algorithm for Bulked Segregant Analysis Sequencing (BSA-Seq) data analysis to detect significant structural variants.

name: deal.II
one_line_profile: Finite element library
detailed_description: A C++ software library supporting the creation of finite element codes and an open community of users and developers.

name: jax-fem
one_line_profile: Differentiable Finite Element Method with JAX
detailed_description: A differentiable Finite Element Method (FEM) library implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and inverse problems in physics simulations.

name: DELLY2

detailed_description: An integrated paired-end and split-read analysis tool for the discovery of structural variants in genomic sequencing data.

name: Viola-SV

name: fenics_topopt_foam

detailed_description: A topology optimization tool that integrates OpenFOAM for fluid dynamics and FEniCS/dolfin-adjoint for sensitivity analysis and optimization. It enables gradient-based topology optimization of fluid flows.

name: DIPY

name: usv_sim_lsa

name: flexFEM

detailed_description: flexFEM is an open-source finite element solver designed for modeling large deformations in soft materials. It provides implementations in both MATLAB and Fortran, suitable for prototyping and high-performance computing.

name: DL4TO
one_line_profile: Deep learning library for 3D topology optimization
detailed_description: DL4TO is a Python library based on PyTorch for 3D topology optimization. It facilitates the integration of deep learning models with topology optimization tasks, supporting differentiable physics and neural network training.

name: LevelSetSwirlFEMandFVM

detailed_description: A MATLAB-based solver for modeling multi-phase flow in velocity fields using Finite Element (FEM) and Finite Volume (FVM) methods, specifically utilizing level set methods for interface tracking.

name: Dojo.jl

detailed_description: Dojo.jl is a differentiable physics engine written in Julia, designed for robotics simulation and control. It supports gradients for physical simulation, enabling optimization and learning-based control approaches.

name: PHiLiP

detailed_description: PHiLiP is a C++ library for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using hp-adaptive Discontinuous Galerkin methods. It is designed for high-performance parallel computing.

name: pyccx

name: NebulaSEM

name: EasyGraph
one_line_profile: Library for advanced network analysis and graph processing
detailed_description: EasyGraph is an open-source Python library for network analysis. It provides functionalities for detecting structural hole spanners, network embedding, and various classic network analysis techniques, optimized for performance.

name: prism
one_line_profile: C++ Computational Fluid Dynamics library based on FVM
detailed_description: Prism is a C++ library for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) utilizing the finite volume method (FVM). It provides a framework for developing and running fluid simulations.

name: ofxCeres

detailed_description: ofxCeres is an addon for OpenFrameworks that interfaces with the Google Ceres non-linear least squares solver. It includes models for scientific and engineering tasks such as structural analysis, kinematics, and calibration.

name: RL2Grid

detailed_description: RL2Grid is a standardized benchmark environment for reinforcement learning agents in power grid management. It models real-time operations like topology optimization and redispatching with AC power flow simulation.

name: OneFLOW
one_line_profile: Large-scale multiphysics scientific simulation environment
detailed_description: OneFLOW is a scientific simulation environment focused on Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and multiphysics problems. It is designed for large-scale simulations.

name: Tiny Differentiable Simulator

detailed_description: A zero-dependency, header-only C++ and CUDA physics library designed for reinforcement learning and robotics. It provides a differentiable simulator enabling gradient-based optimization for physical systems.

name: ExaDG

detailed_description: ExaDG is a high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver framework designed for exascale computing, focusing on efficient parallel solution of partial differential equations.

name: Exasim
one_line_profile: Code generator for Discontinuous Galerkin simulations
detailed_description: Exasim is a tool for generating Discontinuous Galerkin codes optimized for extreme scalable simulations, facilitating the creation of high-performance PDE solvers.

name: BinauralSDM

detailed_description: A set of tools to render Binaural Room Impulse Responses (BRIR) using the Spatial Decomposition Method (SDM), featuring improvements for DOA estimation and reverberation equalization.

name: femR
one_line_profile: R package for solving PDEs using the Finite Element Method
detailed_description: An R package designed for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using the finite element method, bringing FEM capabilities to the R statistical environment.

name: fempar
one_line_profile: Parallel Finite Element Multiphysics solvers
detailed_description: A library of parallel finite element solvers for multiphysics problems, designed for high-performance computing environments.

name: FESTIM

detailed_description: A FEniCS-based tool for modelling coupled hydrogen/tritium transport and heat transfer, primarily used in fusion energy research.

name: Firedrake
one_line_profile: Automated system for solving PDEs using the Finite Element Method

name: qgis2fds

detailed_description: An open source tool to export terrain elevation, landuse, and georeferencing data from QGIS to NIST FDS format for computational fluid dynamics (CFD) wildfire or dispersion simulations.

name: FLEXI
one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for conservation laws

name: Delaunator-Python

name: Hippogriff/rendering

name: ModerateWeightReductionTools

detailed_description: An autoregressive transformer model capable of generating high-quality triangle meshes, representing a data-driven approach to geometry synthesis and mesh generation.

name: Directional
one_line_profile: Library for directional field synthesis and processing on meshes
detailed_description: A C++ library focused on the synthesis, design, and processing of directional fields on 3D meshes, which is critical for tasks like quad-meshing and texture mapping.

name: diff3d
one_line_profile: Visual diff tool for 3D mesh and CAD files
detailed_description: A tool to visually compare 3D models (STL, OBJ, STEP, etc.), useful for quality control and versioning of geometry in engineering workflows.

name: rvesimulator
one_line_profile: Automated RVE simulator for material constitutive law discovery
detailed_description: A Python package that automates Representative Volume Element (RVE) simulations using Abaqus to generate data for discovering material constitutive laws.

name: PyDistMesh
one_line_profile: Simple mesh generator for Python
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the DistMesh algorithm for generating unstructured triangular meshes, suitable for simple domains and quick prototyping.

name: geovista
one_line_profile: Cartographic rendering and mesh analytics for geo-science
detailed_description: Extends PyVista for cartographic projections and mesh analysis, specifically tailored for handling and visualizing unstructured grids in the earth sciences.

name: delaunay-triangulation
one_line_profile: C++ implementation of Delaunay triangulation
detailed_description: A standalone C++ library for performing Delaunay triangulation, a core operation for mesh generation in computational physics and engineering.

name: Restore_3d_model
one_line_profile: Shape-from-Silhouette with texture-based mesh refinement
detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing 3D mesh models from multiple 2D images using Shape-from-Silhouette techniques and texture-based refinement.

name: MeshAnything
one_line_profile: Artist-Created Mesh Generation with Autoregressive Transformers
detailed_description: An AI model that generates high-quality, artist-topology meshes from various inputs, leveraging autoregressive transformers to produce clean geometry suitable for simulation and rendering.

name: MeshAnythingV2
one_line_profile: Enhanced autoregressive mesh generation with adjacent tokenization
detailed_description: The second version of MeshAnything, improving mesh generation quality and consistency through adjacent mesh tokenization techniques.

name: voxelized_geometry_tools
one_line_profile: C++ library for voxel-based geometry processing and signed distance fields
detailed_description: A collection of tools for working with voxelized geometry, including voxel-based collision/occupancy maps, signed-distance fields (SDF), and discrete geometry utilities. Useful for physics simulations requiring volumetric representation of geometry.

name: openMVS
one_line_profile: Library for Multi-View Stereo reconstruction
detailed_description: A library for Multi-View Stereo (MVS) reconstruction, capable of recovering full 3D models from images. It includes algorithms for dense point cloud reconstruction, mesh generation, mesh refinement, and texturing, widely used in geoscience and engineering reverse engineering.

name: GMSH-Airfoil-2D
one_line_profile: Python tool to generate 2D meshes around airfoils using Gmsh
detailed_description: A Python-based utility that interfaces with Gmsh to generate structured or unstructured 2D meshes around airfoil geometries. It automates the pre-processing step for aerodynamic CFD simulations.

name: cg3lib
one_line_profile: C++ geometry processing library
detailed_description: A C++ library for geometry processing, providing data structures and algorithms for handling 2D and 3D geometric objects, meshes, and spatial queries.

name: sdftoolbox
one_line_profile: Python library for Signed Distance Fields manipulation
detailed_description: A vectorized Python library for creating, manipulating, and tessellating Signed Distance Fields (SDFs). It supports generating SDFs from meshes and converting SDFs back to meshes, useful for physics simulations and geometry modeling.

name: pyMeSHSim
one_line_profile: Library for calculating MeSH (Medical Subject Headings) similarity
detailed_description: A Python module to calculate semantic similarity between Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) terms. While the name contains 'MeSH', it refers to biomedical ontology terms, not geometric meshes. It is a scientific tool for bioinformatics/text mining.

name: mesh-sphere-packing
one_line_profile: Tetrahedral mesh generator from sphere packings
detailed_description: A Python tool for generating tetrahedral meshes with periodic boundaries based on sphere packings. This is particularly useful for simulating porous media, granular materials, or microstructures in materials science.

name: SDFGen
one_line_profile: Commandline utility to generate grid-based signed distance fields
detailed_description: A simple but widely used command-line utility to generate grid-based signed distance fields (level sets) from triangle meshes. It is a standard tool in physics-based animation and fluid simulation pipelines.

name: CADMesh
one_line_profile: CAD file interface for GEANT4
detailed_description: A library that allows importing CAD models (STL, PLY, OBJ, etc.) directly into GEANT4 geometry. GEANT4 is a toolkit for the simulation of the passage of particles through matter, widely used in high energy physics and medical physics.

name: PyMeshLab
one_line_profile: Python interface for MeshLab
detailed_description: The official Python library for MeshLab, enabling automated mesh processing scripts. It provides a wide range of mesh cleaning, simplification, and conversion filters used in scientific visualization and geometry processing.

name: MeshLab
one_line_profile: Advanced system for processing and editing 3D triangular meshes
detailed_description: An open-source system for processing and editing 3D triangular meshes. It provides a set of tools for editing, cleaning, healing, inspecting, rendering, and converting meshes, widely used in research for 3D scanning and geometry processing.

name: VCGlib
one_line_profile: C++ library for manipulation and processing of triangle meshes
detailed_description: The Visualization and Computer Graphics Library (VCGlib) is a C++ template library for manipulation, processing, and cleaning of triangle meshes. It is the core library powering MeshLab.

name: salome_cfd_extensions
one_line_profile: Extensions for the SALOME platform for CFD
detailed_description: Modules and extensions for the SALOME platform specifically tailored for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), developed in the context of Code_Saturne. It enhances SALOME's capabilities for mesh generation and case setup for CFD simulations.

name: compas_cgal
one_line_profile: COMPAS package for working with CGAL
detailed_description: A wrapper package that provides an interface between the COMPAS framework (for computational research in architecture and structures) and CGAL (Computational Geometry Algorithms Library), enabling advanced mesh boolean operations and triangulation.

name: pcdmeshing
one_line_profile: Point cloud meshing tool using CGAL
detailed_description: A tool for generating meshes from point clouds using CGAL's reconstruction algorithms. It is useful for converting raw scan data into usable mesh geometry for simulation or visualization.

name: tessagon
one_line_profile: Python library for tessellating 2D manifolds
detailed_description: A Python library to tessellate 2D manifolds with various patterns (triangles, hexagons, etc.). It is useful for generating structured meshes on surfaces for simulation or architectural geometry.

name: delaunay-fast
one_line_profile: Fast Delaunay Triangulation library in JavaScript
detailed_description: A fast JavaScript library for computing Delaunay triangulations of 2D points. While written in JS, it is a fundamental geometric algorithm implementation used in web-based scientific visualization and meshing tools.

name: 2D_CARFIVE

detailed_description: A Fortran-based solver implementing 2D Cartesian Quadtree Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) for the multiphase Five Equations Model. It is a specialized CFD tool for simulating compressible multiphase flows.

name: QTAdaptive
one_line_profile: Quadtree Adaptive Mesh Refinement library
detailed_description: A Fortran library for implementing Quadtree Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) in numerical simulations. It provides the grid management infrastructure for developing AMR-based solvers.

name: JIGSAW

detailed_description: JIGSAW is a computational library for generating high-quality unstructured meshes for general two- and three-dimensional domains. It supports Delaunay-based tessellation and is designed for scientific simulation contexts.

name: JIGSAW (MATLAB)
one_line_profile: MATLAB bindings for the JIGSAW mesh generator
detailed_description: Provides MATLAB interfaces to the JIGSAW mesh generation library, enabling users to generate and manipulate unstructured meshes directly within the MATLAB environment.

name: JIGSAW (Python)

name: bezier

detailed_description: A C# wrapper library that provides access to the straight skeleton calculation functionality of the Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL). It enables .NET applications to perform complex computational geometry tasks.

detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Point Pair Feature (PPF) matching algorithm (Drost-PPF) for 3D object recognition and pose estimation. It includes optional binary extensions for performance, useful in robotics and computer vision.

name: AAGNet
one_line_profile: Automatic machining feature recognition using geometric Attributed Adjacency Graphs
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for recognizing machining features from CAD models (B-Rep). It uses a geometric Attributed Adjacency Graph (gAAG) representation to capture topological and geometric attributes, facilitating automated manufacturing planning.

name: Triangle.NET
one_line_profile: C#/.NET port of the Triangle mesh generator
detailed_description: A C# port of Jonathan Shewchuk's famous 'Triangle' library, which generates high-quality 2D meshes and Delaunay triangulations. It brings robust 2D meshing capabilities to the .NET ecosystem.

name: CAD+
one_line_profile: Automation and productivity toolset for SOLIDWORKS
detailed_description: A comprehensive plugin/toolset for SOLIDWORKS that automates various engineering tasks, including custom property management, geometry feature automation, and batch operations. It enhances the CAD workflow for mechanical engineers.

name: DelaunayTriangulation
one_line_profile: 3D Delaunay triangulation for spherical point clouds
detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Delaunay triangulation in 3D space, specifically optimized for reconstructing convex hulls from spherical point clouds. Useful for geometric reconstruction and surface mesh generation.

name: spherical_voronoi_core
one_line_profile: Library for Voronoi tessellation on a sphere
detailed_description: A C++ library to generate Voronoi tessellations on the surface of a sphere. This is useful for spherical meshing, geospatial analysis, and planetary science simulations.

name: MPM3D-UMAT
one_line_profile: User-defined material models for the MPM3Dpp solver
detailed_description: A collection of C++ user-defined material model subroutines designed for use with the MPM3Dpp material point method solver, enabling simulation of specific material behaviors.

name: dynamic_mascons
one_line_profile: Tool for generating variable-size mascons using spherical Voronoi tessellations
detailed_description: A development tool for creating 3D global variable-size Mass Concentrations (mascons) using iterative spherical Voronoi tessellations, specifically designed for user-defined areas of interest in geophysics and geodesy.

name: Inv_learning
one_line_profile: Deep learning method for computing viscoelastic constitutive model parameters
detailed_description: Implementation of a general deep learning method to solve the inverse problem of computing molecular parameters for viscoelastic constitutive models, aiding in material characterization.

name: trimesh (yig)
one_line_profile: Standalone half-edge mesh data structure library
detailed_description: A lightweight Python library implementing a half-edge data structure for triangular meshes, including a simple OpenGL viewer, with minimal dependencies.

name: CADExchanger (FreeCAD Addon)
one_line_profile: FreeCAD addon for importing and exporting additional CAD formats
detailed_description: An addon for FreeCAD that leverages CAD Exchanger to enable the import and export of various proprietary and standard CAD file formats, enhancing geometry interoperability.

name: cga.js
one_line_profile: 3D computational geometry algorithm library for web
detailed_description: A library providing 3D computational geometry algorithms compatible with WebGL frameworks like three.js and babylon.js, useful for geometric calculations in web-based scientific visualization or modeling.

name: MeshGenerator
one_line_profile: 2D mesh generation script for Finite Element Method
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for generating 2D meshes specifically designed for Finite Element Method (FEM) and Virtual Element Method (VEM) simulations.

name: ofxCGAL
one_line_profile: OpenFrameworks addon wrapping CGAL for computational geometry
detailed_description: An addon for openFrameworks that provides an interface to the Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL), enabling advanced geometric processing capabilities.

name: napari-pymeshlab
one_line_profile: Plugin interfacing napari with PyMeshLab for mesh processing
detailed_description: A plugin that bridges the napari multidimensional image viewer with the PyMeshLab library, allowing users to import, export, and construct surfaces/meshes directly within the viewer.

name: AlignSDF
one_line_profile: Method for pose-aligned signed distance fields reconstruction
detailed_description: Implementation of AlignSDF, a method for reconstructing hand-object interactions using pose-aligned Signed Distance Fields (SDF), contributing to geometric modeling and reconstruction tasks.

name: meshoptimizer
one_line_profile: Library for optimizing meshes for GPU rendering and processing
detailed_description: A library that provides algorithms for mesh optimization, including vertex cache optimization, overdraw reduction, and mesh simplification, widely used for preparing geometry for efficient rendering and simulation visualization.

name: GraSphInv
one_line_profile: Gravity inversion program with adaptive mesh refinement
detailed_description: A program for gravity inversion in spherical coordinates that utilizes adaptive inversion mesh refinement and wavelet compression to handle large-scale geophysical data.

name: EIT-Finite-element-mesh
one_line_profile: Tool for dissecting finite element meshes from images for EIT
detailed_description: Code providing a method for fast dissection of finite element meshes based on input pictures, specifically for Electrical Impedance Tomography (EIT) applications.

name: NeuralMeshRefinement
one_line_profile: Deep learning method for adaptive mesh refinement
detailed_description: Implementation of Neural Mesh Refinement (NMR), a method that learns structural priors to adaptively refine coarse mesh shapes into finer ones based on geometry.

name: matlab-trimesh-stereo-reconstruction
one_line_profile: Stereo reconstruction tool generating 3D tessellated meshes
detailed_description: A MATLAB tool for performing stereo reconstruction to generate 3D tessellated meshes (STL format) from stereo image data.

name: Partition-of-Unity-Isogeometric-Analysis
one_line_profile: Numerical methods for solving elasticity and fracture mechanics using IGA
detailed_description: A Fortran implementation of Galerkin-based numerical methods, specifically Partition of Unity Isogeometric Analysis, for solving elasticity problems, fourth-order PDEs with cracks, and boundary layer problems.

name: Mesh2Volume
one_line_profile: Tool for converting meshes to signed distance field volumes
detailed_description: A C++ tool designed to convert 3D mesh data into Signed Distance Field (SDF) volumes, facilitating geometry processing and implicit surface representation.

name: meshy
one_line_profile: JavaScript library for slicing, measuring, and visualizing polygon meshes
detailed_description: A lightweight library for performing geometric operations on 3D meshes, including slicing, cross-section generation, measurements, and transformations, suitable for web-based engineering visualization.

name: point_cloud_io
one_line_profile: ROS nodes for reading and writing point cloud data files
detailed_description: A ROS package that provides nodes to read point clouds from files (PLY, VTK) and publish them as ROS messages, or save received point cloud messages to files, facilitating data exchange in robotics and engineering.

name: ParaView-Blender-AR
one_line_profile: Workflow tools for exporting ParaView scenes to Blender and AR
detailed_description: A set of scripts and configurations to facilitate the export of scientific visualization scenes from ParaView to Blender for high-quality rendering and Augmented Reality (AR) applications.

name: ParaView-plugins
one_line_profile: Collection of plugins for the ParaView scientific visualization platform
detailed_description: A repository containing various plugins for ParaView, extending its capabilities for specific scientific data visualization and analysis tasks.

name: cpptraj
one_line_profile: Trajectory analysis tool for biomolecular simulations
detailed_description: A comprehensive software package for processing and analyzing molecular dynamics trajectories and data, widely used in the computational chemistry and biology communities.

name: ODB2VTK
one_line_profile: Converter from Abaqus ODB format to VTK format
detailed_description: A utility to convert Abaqus Output Database (ODB) files into VTK format, enabling the visualization of FEA results in open-source tools like ParaView.

name: PyGRDECL
one_line_profile: Tool to visualize Eclipse/Petrel GRDECL grid files using VTK
detailed_description: A Python library for converting and visualizing GRDECL (Corner Point Grid) files used in reservoir simulation (Eclipse/Petrel) into VTK format for analysis in ParaView.

name: FeatureViewerTypeScript
one_line_profile: Library for visualizing protein sequence features
detailed_description: A TypeScript library based on D3.js for creating interactive visualizations of protein sequence features, useful for bioinformatics data presentation.

name: BioExplorer
one_line_profile: Platform for scientific data visualization and exploration
detailed_description: A tool developed by the Blue Brain Project for scientists to extract, analyze, and interactively explore large-scale scientific data through high-fidelity visualization.

name: Livre
one_line_profile: Large-scale Interactive Volume Rendering Engine
detailed_description: An out-of-core, multi-node volume rendering engine designed for visualizing large-scale scientific volumetric data.

name: PyTissueOptics
one_line_profile: Monte Carlo simulations of light transport in tissues
detailed_description: A Python library for performing Monte Carlo simulations of light transport in complex 3D media, specifically designed for tissue optics applications.

name: VolumetricReSTIRRelease
one_line_profile: Fast volume rendering with spatiotemporal reservoir resampling
detailed_description: Implementation of the Volumetric ReSTIR algorithm for efficient and high-quality volume rendering, useful for visualizing complex volumetric scientific data.

name: DataLab
one_line_profile: Open-source platform for scientific signal and image processing
detailed_description: DataLab is a standalone platform designed for scientific and technical data processing and visualization. It provides a comprehensive environment for signal processing, image analysis, and general data manipulation, supporting various file formats and offering an extensible plugin system.

name: OCCReader
one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for importing and visualizing CAD geometries
detailed_description: OCCReader is a plugin for ParaView that enables the import and visualization of CAD files in STEP, BREP, and IGES formats. It bridges the gap between CAD geometry and scientific visualization workflows within the ParaView ecosystem.

name: DnaFeaturesViewer
one_line_profile: Python library for visualizing DNA sequence features
detailed_description: DnaFeaturesViewer is a Python library designed to produce publication-ready plots of DNA sequences and their features (e.g., from Genbank files). It is widely used in bioinformatics for visualizing genetic constructs and sequence annotations.

name: fespp
one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for visualizing Energistics RESQML reservoir data
detailed_description: fespp is a ParaView plugin developed by F2I Consulting that allows for the loading and visualization of RESQML data formats, which are standard in the reservoir engineering and geoscience domains.

name: AMI
one_line_profile: JavaScript toolkit for medical imaging visualization
detailed_description: AMI (AMI Medical Imaging) is a JavaScript toolkit for parsing, processing, and visualizing medical imaging data (such as DICOM) directly in the web browser using WebGL. It enables the development of web-based medical viewers.

name: FlowmapBlue
one_line_profile: Web-based tool for interactive flow map visualization
detailed_description: FlowmapBlue is a tool for visualizing origin-destination movement data (flow maps). It is used in urban science, geography, and transportation research to analyze and visualize mobility patterns.

name: GENIE Generator
one_line_profile: Universal neutrino interaction event generator
detailed_description: The GENIE Generator is a large-scale physics simulation tool used for modeling neutrino interactions. It serves as a primary event generator for many high-energy physics experiments, handling flux, geometry, and event generation.

name: GLVis
one_line_profile: Lightweight OpenGL tool for finite element visualization
detailed_description: GLVis is a lightweight OpenGL-based tool designed for the accurate and flexible visualization of finite element meshes and fields. It supports high-order elements and is often used in conjunction with the MFEM library.

name: glvis-js
one_line_profile: WebAssembly port of the GLVis visualization library
detailed_description: glvis-js is the JavaScript/WebAssembly version of GLVis, enabling high-performance finite element visualization directly in web browsers.

name: pyglvis
one_line_profile: Jupyter Widget for GLVis visualization
detailed_description: pyglvis provides a Python interface and Jupyter Widget for GLVis, allowing users to visualize finite element data interactively within Python environments and Jupyter notebooks.

name: Asclepios DICOM Viewer
one_line_profile: Desktop DICOM viewer for medical imaging
detailed_description: Asclepios is a medical imaging viewer developed in C++, Qt, and VTK. It allows for the visualization and manipulation of DICOM files, supporting 2D and 3D viewing modes.

name: hedgehog-lab
one_line_profile: Browser-based scientific computing and visualization environment
detailed_description: hedgehog-lab is an open-source scientific computing environment that runs entirely in the browser. It allows users to write JavaScript for matrix operations, symbolic computation, and data visualization, similar to a web-based MATLAB or Mathematica.

name: AttentionLens-LVLM
one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for attention flow in Large Vision-Language Models
detailed_description: AttentionLens-LVLM is a toolkit designed to visualize and analyze the attention mechanisms within Large Vision-Language Models. It helps researchers diagnose model behaviors by rendering token-to-token attention maps and cross-modal attention paths.

name: ImagePy
one_line_profile: Plugin-based image processing framework
detailed_description: ImagePy is an open-source image processing framework written in Python. It mimics the plugin architecture of ImageJ, allowing easy integration with scientific libraries like NumPy, SciPy, and scikit-image for building custom image analysis workflows.

name: myvi
one_line_profile: Lightweight 3D visualization library based on VTK
detailed_description: myvi is a simplified and lightweight Python library for 3D visualization, built on top of VTK. It aims to provide a more accessible interface for scientific visualization tasks compared to heavier alternatives like Mayavi.

name: skillet
one_line_profile: Interactive scientific visualization application in Rust
detailed_description: skillet is a lightweight, standalone application written in Rust for interactive scientific visualization. It focuses on performance and ease of use for visualizing scientific data.

name: GLVisualize.jl
one_line_profile: High-performance visualization library for Julia using OpenGL
detailed_description: A visualization library written in Julia and OpenGL, designed for high-performance rendering of scientific data, including 2D/3D plots, particles, and meshes.

name: MeshViz.jl
one_line_profile: Visualization recipes for Meshes.jl using Makie.jl
detailed_description: Provides Makie.jl recipes for visualizing geometric meshes defined by the Meshes.jl library, facilitating the inspection of computational geometry and finite element meshes.

name: Meshing.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library providing algorithms for isosurface extraction (e.g., Marching Cubes, Marching Tetrahedra) from volumetric data, essential for generating meshes for simulation or visualization.

name: Molly.jl
one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics simulation framework in Julia
detailed_description: A pure Julia package for molecular dynamics simulations, supporting various force fields, integrators, and analysis tools for physical and chemical systems.

name: OceanRobots.jl
one_line_profile: Toolbox for oceanographic robot data analysis and simulation
detailed_description: A Julia package for the analysis, processing, and simulation of data generated by scientific robots in the ocean, supporting oceanographic research.

name: MeshCatMechanisms.jl

detailed_description: Provides 3D visualization of mechanisms and URDF files using MeshCat.jl and RigidBodyDynamics.jl, useful for robotics simulation and analysis.

name: VTKDataIO.jl
one_line_profile: IO library for VTK mesh data in Julia
detailed_description: A package for reading, writing, and visualizing mesh data in Julia, providing an interface to Python's VTK library for interoperability.

name: WriteVTK.jl

detailed_description: A Julia package for writing VTK XML files (vtu, vtp, vts, etc.), enabling the export of simulation data for visualization in ParaView or VisIt.

name: pythonInteractAbaqus
one_line_profile: Python framework for Abaqus pre/post-processing
detailed_description: A general pre- and post-processing framework for finite element analysis software like ABAQUS and OpenSees, automating simulation workflows.

name: K3D-jupyter
one_line_profile: 3D visualization widget for Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A Jupyter widget for creating 3D plots backed by WebGL, supporting surfaces, isosurfaces, voxels, meshes, and VTK objects for interactive scientific visualization.

name: 3DVisualizer
one_line_profile: Interactive 3D visualization for multivariate gridded data
detailed_description: A highly interactive application for visualization and analysis of 3D multivariate gridded data from FEM simulations, microscopy, or medical imaging.

name: PCLPlugin

detailed_description: A plugin that enables Point Cloud Library (PCL) functionality within ParaView, allowing for advanced processing and visualization of point cloud data.

name: ParaView
one_line_profile: Multi-platform data analysis and visualization application
detailed_description: An open-source, multi-platform data analysis and visualization application based on VTK, designed to analyze extremely large datasets using distributed memory computing resources.

name: ParaViewTangoRecorder

detailed_description: An application for the Project Tango development kit to record 3D data for visualization and analysis in ParaView.

name: VTK

detailed_description: An open-source software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization, serving as the foundation for ParaView and many other scientific tools.

name: VolView
one_line_profile: Web-based 3D radiological viewer
detailed_description: A 3D radiological viewer for DICOM data, volume rendering, and annotations, running entirely in the browser.

name: Glance
one_line_profile: Web application for visualizing volumetric and geometric data
detailed_description: An open-source web application for visualizing volumetric images, molecular structures, geometric objects, and point clouds, built on VTK.js and ITK.js.

name: itk-vtk-viewer

detailed_description: A web-based viewer for images, meshes, and point sets using itk-wasm and vtk.js, suitable for medical and scientific data visualization.

name: ParaView Lite

detailed_description: A lite web client for a ParaView server, enabling remote visualization and analysis via web technologies.

name: paraview-trame-components

detailed_description: High-level components for building ParaView-based applications using the Trame framework.

name: ParaViewWeb

detailed_description: A web framework for building interactive visualization applications relying on VTK or ParaView to produce visualization data.

name: py-web-vue

detailed_description: A library to build 3D web applications using VTK or ParaView by writing only Python scripts, streamlining the creation of visualization tools.

name: Trame

detailed_description: A Python script designed to convert Abaqus ODB simulation result files into VTK format, enabling post-processing and visualization in open-source tools like ParaView.

detailed_description: A C++ repository implementing volume rendering techniques, providing a codebase for visualizing 3D volumetric data.

detailed_description: A specialized visualization tool or plugin based on ParaView, tailored for the specific needs of geoscience data analysis and visualization.

detailed_description: A JavaScript library for high-performance visualization and interactive exploration of scientific and geospatial location-aware datasets in web environments.

detailed_description: A Python tool using Mayavi to visualize VASP POSCAR files, aiding in the structural analysis of materials science simulations.

name: veux

detailed_description: A Python framework designed for visualizing finite element analysis (FEA) data. It provides tools to render meshes and simulation results, facilitating post-processing of engineering simulations.

name: ScopeFoundry

detailed_description: ScopeFoundry is a Python platform for controlling custom laboratory experiments and visualizing scientific data in real-time. It provides a framework for hardware control and data acquisition.

detailed_description: A deep learning project applied to signal integrity and RF analysis. It provides automated modeling, simulation, and data storage wrappers for HFSS (High Frequency Structure Simulator), specifically for patch antennas, transmission lines, and connectors.

name: SimVascular
one_line_profile: Pipeline for medical image segmentation to blood flow simulation
detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source software package providing a complete pipeline from medical image data segmentation to patient-specific blood flow simulation and analysis. It is widely used in cardiovascular modeling.

name: 3D Slicer

detailed_description: Multi-platform, free open source software for visualization and image computing. It is a standard tool for medical image analysis, visualization, and image-guided therapy.

name: iFeatureOmega-CLI

detailed_description: A comprehensive platform for generating, analyzing, and visualizing representations for biological sequences, 3D structures, and ligands. This is the Command Line Interface version suitable for pipelines.

name: iFeatureOmega-GUI

detailed_description: The Graphical User Interface version of iFeatureOmega, designed for generating, analyzing, and visualizing representations for biological sequences, 3D structures, and ligands.

name: MeshSegNet

detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of MeshSegNet for automated tooth segmentation from intraoral scans (point cloud/mesh). It serves as a specialized tool for 3D medical mesh analysis.

name: VisualFactory

detailed_description: A collection of scripts for molecular visualization designed to produce high-quality visuals with scientific accuracy. It bridges scientific data with cinematic rendering tools.

name: VisTrails

detailed_description: VisTrails is an open-source data analysis and visualization tool that provides a comprehensive provenance infrastructure. It maintains detailed history of the steps followed and data derived in exploratory scientific tasks.

name: Volume-Unity-Plugin

detailed_description: A Unity3D plugin for rendering volumetric data assets. It enables scientific volume visualization (e.g., medical scans, simulation fields) within the Unity engine.

name: 3d-nii-visualizer

detailed_description: A lightweight 3D visualization tool specifically designed for NIfTI medical imaging data, utilizing VTK for rendering and Qt5 for the interface. It supports viewing and interacting with volumetric data common in medical physics and bio-engineering.

detailed_description: A desktop application for processing and visualizing 3D point cloud data. It integrates the Point Cloud Library (PCL) algorithms for filtering, segmentation, and registration, providing a GUI for engineering and geomatics applications.

name: SciColorMaps
one_line_profile: Custom .NET color maps for scientific visualization
detailed_description: A library providing scientific color maps (including matplotlib styles) for .NET applications. It is a specialized component for enhancing scientific data visualization in C# environments.

name: F3DASM
one_line_profile: Framework for Data-Driven Design & Analysis of Structures & Materials
detailed_description: A Python framework designed for the data-driven design and analysis of structures and materials. It facilitates the generation of datasets, integration with simulation tools, and application of machine learning for material science and structural engineering problems.

name: rust-isosurface-extraction
one_line_profile: Library for extracting meshes from voxel data using isosurface algorithms
detailed_description: A Rust library that implements algorithms (like Marching Cubes) to convert volumetric voxel data into triangular meshes. This is a fundamental operation in scientific visualization, medical imaging, and CFD post-processing.

name: Kitware.VTK (C# Wrapper)
one_line_profile: Experimental C# wrapper for the Visualization Toolkit (VTK)
detailed_description: A C# wrapper for Kitware's VTK (Visualization Toolkit), enabling .NET developers to utilize VTK's powerful scientific visualization and data processing capabilities. VTK is a standard library for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization in scientific computing.

name: geovista-slam
one_line_profile: Tool for generating Structured Local Area Model (SLAM) grids from unstructured meshes
detailed_description: A specialized tool within the geovista ecosystem for generating Structured Local Area Model (SLAM) grids from unstructured meshes, facilitating specific geospatial analysis and modeling tasks.

name: BlenderNC
one_line_profile: Blender addon to visualize scientific gridded data (NetCDF)
detailed_description: A Blender add-on that enables the import and visualization of scientific gridded data, specifically NetCDF files. It allows scientists to use Blender's advanced rendering capabilities for oceanographic, atmospheric, and climate data visualization.

name: fast-surface-nets-rs
one_line_profile: Fast isosurface extraction algorithm implementation in Rust
detailed_description: A Rust implementation of the Surface Nets algorithm for fast isosurface extraction from volumetric data. It produces high-quality meshes from voxel grids, suitable for scientific visualization and geometry processing.

name: XLToolbox
one_line_profile: Excel add-in for scientific data analysis and visualization
detailed_description: An open-source add-in for Microsoft Excel designed to assist with scientific and technical data analysis and visualization. It provides tools for chart management, data analysis, and export, tailored for publication-quality figures.

name: kMap.py
one_line_profile: Simulation and data analysis tool for photoemission tomography
detailed_description: A Python-based program for simulation and data analysis in photoemission tomography (momentum microscopy). It handles data processing and visualization specific to this experimental technique in physics.

name: BlenderGeoModeller
one_line_profile: Blender add-on for 3D geological modelling and visualization
detailed_description: A Blender add-on providing tools for 3D geological modelling, primarily for mineral exploration. It supports importing drill hole data, point data, generating block models, and integrates with GemPy for implicit geological modelling.

name: powsimR
one_line_profile: Power analysis tool for RNA-seq experiments
detailed_description: A flexible tool to simulate and evaluate differential expression from bulk and single-cell RNA-seq data. It is used for a priori and posterior power analyses to optimize experimental design in genomics.

name: SphGLLTools
one_line_profile: Toolbox for visualization and processing of GLL mesh tomographic models
detailed_description: A toolbox for visualization, processing, and spherical harmonics analysis of tomographic models defined on Gauss-Lobatto-Legendre (GLL) meshes, commonly used in spectral element methods for geophysics.

name: climakitae
one_line_profile: Toolkit for analyzing and visualizing Cal-Adapt climate data
detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for retrieving, visualizing, and performing scientific analyses with climate data from the Cal-Adapt Analytics Engine. It simplifies access to complex climate datasets for researchers.

name: feature-viewer
one_line_profile: Library to visualize protein sequence features
detailed_description: A JavaScript library using D3 to visualize protein sequence features. Developed by the SIB CALIPHO group for the neXtProt project, it allows for interactive display of biological annotations on protein sequences.

name: samui
one_line_profile: Performant scientific image visualization system
detailed_description: A scientific image visualization system designed for performance. It likely handles large-scale image data typical in microscopy or other scientific imaging domains.

name: cellxgene
one_line_profile: Interactive explorer for single-cell transcriptomics data
detailed_description: An interactive data explorer for single-cell transcriptomics data. It enables biologists to visualize and analyze large-scale single-cell datasets to understand cellular heterogeneity.

name: mitsuba-visualize
one_line_profile: Tool to visualize meshes and pointclouds using Mitsuba renderer
detailed_description: A Python tool that leverages the Mitsuba renderer to create publication-quality visualizations of meshes, point clouds, and video flythroughs. It is useful for rendering scientific geometry data with high fidelity.

name: Feature-Selection-Visualization
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for forward stepwise feature selection residuals
detailed_description: A Python tool to plot residuals during forward stepwise feature selection. This helps in analyzing the performance and stability of feature selection processes in machine learning and statistical modeling.

name: FeatureMap_Visualize_Pytorch
one_line_profile: Tool to visualize feature maps in PyTorch models
detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation for visualizing feature maps of convolutional neural networks. This is essential for interpreting and debugging deep learning models used in scientific AI applications.

name: nexus
one_line_profile: Library for creation and visualization of batched multiresolution meshes
detailed_description: A C++/JavaScript library designed for the efficient creation and visualization of large-scale, batched multiresolution meshes. It supports streaming and rendering of massive geometric datasets, common in cultural heritage and scientific visualization.

name: CTK
one_line_profile: Common Toolkit for medical imaging and surgical navigation
detailed_description: A set of common support code for medical imaging, surgical navigation, and related purposes. It provides widgets and libraries to build medical image analysis and visualization applications, often used in conjunction with VTK and ITK.

name: compas_fea2
one_line_profile: Finite Element Analysis toolbox for the COMPAS framework
detailed_description: A package that extends the COMPAS framework to support Finite Element Analysis (FEA). It provides a unified interface to various FEA solvers (like Abaqus, Ansys, Opensees) for architectural and structural engineering research.

name: AutoInt
one_line_profile: Automatic Integration for Fast Neural Volume Rendering
detailed_description: Implementation of AutoInt, a method for automatic integration to accelerate neural volume rendering. This is a research code for advanced visualization and rendering techniques using neural networks.

name: Lab
one_line_profile: HTML5-based scientific models and visualizations platform
detailed_description: A platform for creating and running HTML5-based scientific models, visualizations, and graphing tools. It is primarily used for educational simulations in physics, chemistry, and biology, allowing for interactive exploration of scientific concepts.

name: aphros
one_line_profile: Finite volume solver for incompressible multiphase flows
detailed_description: A finite volume solver designed for incompressible multiphase flows with surface tension. It is capable of simulating complex phenomena like foaming flows in complex geometries, suitable for fluid dynamics research.

name: pyF3D
one_line_profile: Image processing library for many-core platforms
detailed_description: A Python library for high-performance image processing on many-core and multi-core platforms. It appears to be related to fast 3D imaging or processing tasks in scientific contexts (LBNL origin).

name: pathgraph
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for ray tracing algorithms
detailed_description: A tool for creating visualizations of ray tracing algorithms. It helps in understanding and debugging the path of rays in rendering simulations, which is relevant for computational physics and graphics research.

name: Datoviz
one_line_profile: High-performance GPU rendering library for scientific data visualization
detailed_description: Datoviz is a high-performance library for scientific data visualization that leverages the Vulkan graphics API for GPU-accelerated rendering. It is designed to handle large datasets efficiently, providing fast and interactive visualizations for scientific computing.

name: dicom2stl
one_line_profile: Tool to extract STL surface meshes from DICOM image series
detailed_description: A Python script and tool designed to convert medical DICOM image series into STL surface meshes. It supports processing of medical imaging data for 3D printing or visualization purposes.

name: bpy-visualization-utils
one_line_profile: Blender utilities for scientific visualization of meshes and point clouds
detailed_description: A collection of Blender (bpy) utilities designed to facilitate the creation of paper-ready visualizations for scientific data, including meshes, point clouds, and occupancy grids.

name: Activiz.NET
one_line_profile: .NET wrapper for the Visualization Toolkit (VTK)
detailed_description: Activiz.NET is a .NET wrapper for VTK (Visualization Toolkit), enabling C# and .NET developers to utilize VTK's powerful scientific visualization and data processing capabilities within .NET applications.

name: fsbrain
one_line_profile: R library for visualization of structural neuroimaging data
detailed_description: An R library focused on structural neuroimaging, providing high-level functions to access, read, write, and visualize surface-based brain morphometry data for individuals and groups.

name: vtk-dicom
one_line_profile: DICOM support library for VTK
detailed_description: A set of classes for using DICOM medical imaging data within the VTK (Visualization Toolkit) environment. It provides functionality for reading, writing, and processing DICOM metadata and image data.

name: nla3d
one_line_profile: 2D/3D finite element programming framework
detailed_description: A C++ framework for 2D and 3D finite element analysis (FEA), designed for non-linear analysis of solids and structures.

name: Thalassa
one_line_profile: Large scale visualizations of unstructured mesh data
detailed_description: A tool developed by EC-JRC for large-scale visualization of unstructured mesh data, likely used in oceanographic or environmental simulations.

name: DicomToMesh
one_line_profile: Command line tool to transform DICOM volumes into 3D surface meshes
detailed_description: A command-line utility for converting DICOM volumetric data into 3D surface meshes (OBJ, STL, PLY). It includes mesh processing routines such as reduction, smoothing, and cleaning.

name: Mayavi
one_line_profile: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python
detailed_description: Mayavi is a powerful and user-friendly 3D scientific data visualization tool and library for Python. It provides a magic GUI for easy interaction and a scripting interface for automation, built on top of VTK.

name: Epiviz
one_line_profile: Scientific information visualization tool for genetic and epigenetic data
detailed_description: Epiviz is an interactive visualization tool for functional genomics data. It aids in the exploration and understanding of correlations between various genome features through a web-based interface.

name: ERT
one_line_profile: Ensemble based Reservoir Tool for sensitivity analysis and data assimilation
detailed_description: ERT (Ensemble based Reservoir Tool) is designed for running ensembles of dynamical models, particularly reservoir models. It supports sensitivity analysis and data assimilation using Ensemble Smoother methods.

name: FlowCytometryTools
one_line_profile: Python package for visualization and analysis of flow cytometry data
detailed_description: A Python package designed for the analysis and visualization of high-throughput flow cytometry data, providing tools for gating, transformation, and plotting.

name: F3D
one_line_profile: Fast and minimalist 3D viewer for scientific meshes and data
detailed_description: F3D is a fast, minimalist, cross-platform 3D viewer that supports many file formats (VTK, STL, PLY, OBJ, etc.). It is designed for quick visualization of scientific meshes and point clouds.

name: iso2mesh
one_line_profile: 3D surface and volumetric mesh generator for MATLAB/Octave
detailed_description: Iso2Mesh is a MATLAB/Octave-based mesh generation toolbox. It can create 3D tetrahedral finite element (FE) meshes from volumetric images (MRI/CT) and surface meshes from geometric primitives.

name: Feel++
one_line_profile: Finite Element Embedded Language and Library in C++
detailed_description: Feel++ is a C++ library for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using the finite element method (FEM). It provides a domain-specific language (DSL) embedded in C++ to mathematically describe and solve complex physics problems.

name: BlenderPipeline
one_line_profile: Scientific data visualization pipeline for Blender
detailed_description: A collection of scripts and examples designed to facilitate the import and visualization of scientific data within the Blender 3D creation suite, enabling high-quality rendering of research results.

name: Flow
one_line_profile: Deep Reinforcement Learning framework for traffic control
detailed_description: A computational framework for applying reinforcement learning to traffic control scenarios, enabling the simulation and optimization of traffic dynamics using microscopic simulators like SUMO.

name: napari-feature-visualization

detailed_description: A plugin for the napari image viewer that allows users to visualize quantitative feature measurements directly on label images, facilitating bioimage analysis and quality control.

name: flowiz
one_line_profile: Optical flow visualization utility
detailed_description: A utility to convert optical flow files (.flo) into visualizable images or videos, supporting standard formats used in computer vision and fluid dynamics research.

name: signatureSearch

detailed_description: An R/Bioconductor package for Gene Expression Signature Search (GESS) and Function Enrichment Analysis (FEA), supporting drug-target network construction and visualization for drug discovery.

detailed_description: A Python library for scientific visualization that leverages the GPU via OpenGL to provide fast, scalable, and high-quality rendering of large datasets.

detailed_description: A Python tool for the analysis and visualization of molecular dynamics (MD) simulation data, focusing on residue-residue interactions and other molecular properties.

detailed_description: A scientific research data management platform designed for storing, managing, and visualizing data from preclinical drug discovery phases.

detailed_description: A user-friendly data analysis and visualization program aimed at high-quality plotting of scientific data, similar to Origin or SigmaPlot.

detailed_description: A framework designed for the data-driven design and analysis of materials, supporting modeling and simulation tasks in materials science.

detailed_description: A Python package for GPU-accelerated volume rendering and processing, specifically designed for visualizing 3D/4D biological image data.

detailed_description: A Python library that provides a WebGL-based 3D visualizer, widely used in robotics and physics simulations for visualizing geometries, transformations, and mechanism trajectories.

detailed_description: A software suite for meteorological data visualization and analysis, integrating GIS capabilities and scientific computation tools for handling atmospheric data formats.

detailed_description: A workflow tool designed to streamline the creation of publication-quality scientific figures. It integrates Python plotting libraries like Matplotlib and PyVista with Inkscape for vector graphics editing, ensuring reproducible and high-quality visual outputs for research papers.

detailed_description: The official implementation of Acoustic Volume Rendering (AVR), a method for rendering neural impulse response fields. It is used for visualizing and simulating acoustic propagation in 3D environments using neural rendering techniques.

name: AcoustiX

detailed_description: The companion repository for Acoustic Volume Rendering, providing the simulation framework or data handling capabilities required for generating and processing acoustic fields for neural rendering tasks.

detailed_description: A standalone GUI application or framework component built on top of PyVista, allowing users to interactively visualize and manipulate 3D data without writing code.
