detailed_description: pycvodes provides Python bindings for the CVODES solver from the SUNDIALS suite, enabling integration of ordinary differential equations with sensitivity analysis.

name: pykinsol
one_line_profile: Python wrapper for the KINSOL nonlinear solver
detailed_description: pykinsol provides Python bindings for the KINSOL solver from the SUNDIALS suite, used for solving systems of nonlinear algebraic equations.

name: dolfinx_materials
one_line_profile: Material constitutive behavior library for FEniCSx
detailed_description: dolfinx_materials is an add-on for FEniCSx that enables the definition and simulation of complex material constitutive behaviors not expressible with standard UFL operators.

name: dolfinx_optim
one_line_profile: Convex optimization add-on for FEniCSx
detailed_description: dolfinx_optim provides a Domain-Specific Language (DSL) within the FEniCSx Python interface to define and solve convex optimization problems involving finite elements.

name: cuda-dolfinx
one_line_profile: GPU acceleration extension for FEniCSx
detailed_description: cuda-dolfinx is an extension library that provides GPU acceleration capabilities for the FEniCSx finite element framework.

name: CasADi
one_line_profile: Symbolic framework for numeric optimization and automatic differentiation
detailed_description: CasADi is a symbolic framework for numeric optimization that implements automatic differentiation on sparse matrix-valued computational graphs, supporting C-code generation and interfacing with solvers like SUNDIALS and IPOPT.

name: CASK
one_line_profile: Custom architecture generator for sparse linear algebra
detailed_description: CASK is a tool to generate and tune custom architectures specifically optimized for sparse linear algebra operations.

name: TRUST
one_line_profile: Thermohydraulic CFD simulation software
detailed_description: TRUST is a software package for thermohydraulic CFD simulations, supporting incompressible and compressible multi-phase flows, with ongoing GPU acceleration support.

name: krnl
one_line_profile: Safe and portable GPGPU compute kernels
detailed_description: krnl is a library for writing safe, portable, and high-performance GPGPU compute kernels in Rust.

name: PFEMFort
one_line_profile: Parallel Finite Element Analysis framework using Fortran and PETSc
detailed_description: PFEMFort is a framework for parallel finite element analysis, leveraging Fortran for computation and PETSc for parallel linear algebra solvers.

name: Biome
one_line_profile: Moose-based BioPerl implementation
detailed_description: Biome is an experimental implementation of BioPerl functionalities using the Moose object system, aimed at bioinformatics data processing.

name: CLAW Compiler
one_line_profile: Compiler for performance portability in weather and climate models
detailed_description: The CLAW Compiler is a source-to-source translator that provides performance portability for weather and climate models (like COSMO) on heterogeneous architectures.

name: PyClaw
one_line_profile: Python interface for Clawpack and SharpClaw solvers
detailed_description: PyClaw is a Python-based interface to the Clawpack and SharpClaw algorithms for solving hyperbolic PDEs, including PetClaw for parallel execution via PETSc.

name: VisionCpp
one_line_profile: SYCL-based machine vision library
detailed_description: VisionCpp is a machine vision library written in SYCL and C++ that provides performance-portable implementations of graph algorithms and vision processing tasks.

name: HiSparse
one_line_profile: High-performance sparse linear algebra on FPGAs
detailed_description: HiSparse is a framework for high-performance sparse linear algebra operations on HBM-equipped FPGAs using High-Level Synthesis (HLS).

name: CP2K
one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry and solid state physics software
detailed_description: CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems.

name: Russell
one_line_profile: Rust Scientific Library for ODEs, linear algebra, and tensor calculus
detailed_description: Russell is a scientific library for Rust providing solvers for ODEs and DAEs, sparse linear algebra (interfacing MUMPS/UMFPACK), and tensor calculus utilities.

name: lass
one_line_profile: Linear algebra library for structured sparse matrices
detailed_description: A Python library for performing linear algebra operations on structured sparse matrices, developed by the Stanford Convex Optimization Group.

name: spgpu
one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra library for GPUs
detailed_description: A CUDA library for performing sparse linear algebra operations on GPUs, targeting high-performance computing applications.

name: deal-fsi
one_line_profile: Linear elasticity solver for fluid-structure interaction using deal.II
detailed_description: A linear elasticity solver implemented using the deal.II library, designed as a component for fluid-structure interaction (FSI) simulations.

name: matrix-free-dealii-precice
one_line_profile: Matrix-free solid solver for coupled FSI using deal.II and preCICE
detailed_description: A high-performance, matrix-free solid mechanics solver built with deal.II, designed for coupled fluid-structure interactions via the preCICE coupling library.

name: jacobi
one_line_profile: Benchmark for solving 2D Laplace equation using Jacobi method
detailed_description: A benchmark tool for evaluating performance on GPUs and Xeon Phi by solving the 2D Laplace equation using the Jacobi iterative method.

name: amgcl
one_line_profile: C++ library for algebraic multigrid (AMG) methods
detailed_description: A header-only C++ library for solving large sparse linear systems using algebraic multigrid (AMG) methods, supporting various backends including OpenMP, CUDA, and OpenCL.

name: ddX
one_line_profile: Fast continuum solvation solver based on domain decomposition
detailed_description: A Fortran library for fast continuum solvation calculations using domain decomposition methods, suitable for integration into quantum chemistry packages.

name: candi

detailed_description: A shell script tool to download, configure, build, and install the deal.II finite element library and its dependencies.

name: numerical-pde-solvers

detailed_description: A collection of numerical solvers including spectral-element methods for 1D/2D wave and Helmholtz equations, and domain decomposition solvers.

name: MaximumSize_on_TopOpt_in_PETSc
one_line_profile: Maximum size constraints implementation for topology optimization in PETSc
detailed_description: An extension to the TopOpt_in_PETSc code that implements maximum size constraints for topology optimization problems.

name: Elemental
one_line_profile: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra library
detailed_description: A modern C++ library for distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra, conic optimization, and lattice reduction.

name: emg3d
one_line_profile: Multigrid solver for 3D electromagnetic diffusion
detailed_description: A multigrid solver for 3D electromagnetic diffusion, designed for geophysics and electromagnetics applications.

name: entity
one_line_profile: Astrophysical plasma simulation code with CPU/GPU portability
detailed_description: A new generation code for astrophysical plasma simulations, featuring portability across CPU and GPU architectures.

name: tmLQCD
one_line_profile: Lattice QCD simulation software suite
detailed_description: A software suite for lattice QCD simulations, implementing HMC and various Dirac operators, optimized for parallel architectures.

name: NeoN
one_line_profile: Modern CFD core prototype
detailed_description: A prototype implementation of a modern Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) core, focusing on high-order methods.

name: ddPCM
one_line_profile: Domain decomposition based COSMO solvation model implementation
detailed_description: A fast implementation of the COSMO solvation model using domain decomposition techniques, written in Fortran.

name: fenicsx-pulse
one_line_profile: Cardiac mechanics solver based on FEniCSx
detailed_description: A next-generation solver for cardiac mechanics simulations built upon the FEniCSx finite element framework.

name: SkellySim
one_line_profile: Hydrodynamic Cytoskeleton Simulator
detailed_description: A simulation tool for hydrodynamic cytoskeleton interactions, modeling fibers and bodies in fluid.

name: synergia2
one_line_profile: Accelerator modeling and simulation package
detailed_description: A package for modeling and simulating particle accelerators, developed at Fermilab, focusing on beam dynamics and space charge effects.

name: HYPRE.jl
one_line_profile: Julia interface to HYPRE linear solvers
detailed_description: A Julia interface to the HYPRE library, providing access to high-performance preconditioners and solvers for sparse linear systems.

name: AxiSEM
one_line_profile: Parallel spectral-element method for 3D wave propagation in axisymmetric media
detailed_description: AxiSEM is a parallel spectral-element method to solve 3D wave propagation in a sphere with axisymmetric or spherically symmetric visco-elastic, acoustic, anisotropic structures.

name: MANDYOC
one_line_profile: Finite element code for mantle convection simulation
detailed_description: MANDYOC is a finite element code written on top of the PETSc library to simulate thermo-chemical convection of the Earth's mantle.

name: MOF Generation at Scale
one_line_profile: Generative AI and simulation workflow for MOF discovery
detailed_description: Create new Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs) by combining generative AI and simulation on HPC infrastructure.

name: OpenSayal
one_line_profile: Real-time GPU accelerated fluid simulator
detailed_description: Real-time GPU accelerated fluid simulator designed for high performance.

name: GridapDistributed.jl
one_line_profile: Distributed-memory parallel extension for Gridap
detailed_description: Parallel distributed-memory version of Gridap, a Julia library for grid-based approximations of partial differential equations.

name: GridapPETSc.jl
one_line_profile: PETSc interface for Gridap
detailed_description: Provides PETSc solvers to the Gridap project, enabling scalable linear and nonlinear solvers for FEM.

name: parallel
one_line_profile: Stata module for parallel computing
detailed_description: A Stata module to implement parallel computing, accelerating statistical analysis and simulations.

name: Halide
one_line_profile: Language for fast, portable data-parallel computation
detailed_description: A programming language designed to make it easier to write high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.

name: DeepLM
one_line_profile: Large-scale Nonlinear Least Squares solver on Deep Learning Frameworks
detailed_description: DeepLM enables large-scale Nonlinear Least Squares solving on Deep Learning Frameworks using Stochastic Domain Decomposition.

name: raccoon
one_line_profile: Massively parallel FEM code for phase-field fracture
detailed_description: Massively parallel Finite Element Method (FEM) code for phase-field modeling of fracture, developed by Dolbow Lab at Duke University.

name: sxamg
one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) Solver Library
detailed_description: A library implementing Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) methods for solving large sparse linear systems.

name: hypre
one_line_profile: Scalable linear solvers and multigrid methods
detailed_description: Library of high-performance preconditioners and solvers for the solution of large, sparse linear systems of equations on massively parallel computers.

name: MaCaw
one_line_profile: Domain-decomposed neutral particle transport application
detailed_description: MaCaw is a MOOSE-based application that enables domain-decomposed neutral particle transport calculations, leveraging ray tracing and OpenMC.

name: Idefix
one_line_profile: Fast finite volume code for astrophysical flows
detailed_description: A fast finite volume code designed to run on many architectures (GPU, CPU) using Kokkos, primarily for astrophysical fluid dynamics.

name: Inductiva
one_line_profile: API for large-scale physics simulations
detailed_description: A Python API to execute large-scale physics simulations on the cloud, simplifying access to HPC resources.

name: SundialsML
one_line_profile: OCaml interface to the Sundials suite of numeric solvers
detailed_description: A comprehensive interface for the OCaml language to the Sundials suite of numerical solvers, enabling high-performance solving of ODEs and DAEs in a functional programming environment.

name: petsc4foam
one_line_profile: Library to use PETSc linear solvers within the OpenFOAM framework
detailed_description: An experimental library that embeds PETSc's high-performance linear solvers into OpenFOAM, aiming to accelerate CFD simulations through advanced preconditioning and solver algorithms.

name: JAGURS
one_line_profile: Parallel tsunami simulation code solving long-wave/Boussinesq equations
detailed_description: A tsunami simulation code that solves linear/nonlinear long-wave and Boussinesq equations, supporting effects like elastic earth deformation and seawater density stratification, parallelized with OpenMP and MPI.

name: octree-mg
one_line_profile: MPI geometric multigrid solver for quadtree/octree grids
detailed_description: A geometric multigrid solver designed for quadtree (2D) and octree (3D) grids, utilizing MPI for parallel execution, suitable for solving PDEs on adaptive meshes.

name: adios4dolfinx
one_line_profile: Checkpointing and I/O extension for DOLFINx using ADIOS2
detailed_description: A library extending DOLFINx with advanced checkpointing capabilities using ADIOS2, facilitating efficient I/O for large-scale finite element simulations and restarts.

name: dolfinx_mpc
one_line_profile: Extension for DOLFINx to handle multi-point constraints
detailed_description: An extension for the DOLFINx finite element library that enables the definition and enforcement of multi-point constraints (MPC), such as periodic boundary conditions or rigid body motions.

name: mpres-blas
one_line_profile: Multiple-precision GPU accelerated linear algebra routines
detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated library for dense and sparse linear algebra operations supporting multiple-precision arithmetic based on residue number systems, targeting high-precision scientific computing.

name: Kokkos
one_line_profile: C++ Performance Portability Programming Ecosystem for HPC
detailed_description: A comprehensive C++ programming model and library for writing performance-portable applications that run efficiently on diverse HPC architectures (multicore CPUs, GPUs, etc.) by abstracting memory and execution models.

name: Kokkos Comm
one_line_profile: Experimental Explicit Communications API for Kokkos
detailed_description: An experimental library within the Kokkos ecosystem providing explicit communication APIs (like MPI abstractions) designed to work seamlessly with Kokkos's execution and memory spaces.

name: kokkos-fft
one_line_profile: Shared-memory FFT library for the Kokkos HPC ecosystem
detailed_description: A library providing Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) capabilities designed to work seamlessly within the Kokkos performance portability ecosystem, enabling efficient spectral methods on diverse HPC architectures.

name: kokkos-fortran-interop
one_line_profile: Interoperability tools for mixing Fortran and Kokkos C++ code
detailed_description: Provides interfaces and tools to facilitate the interaction between legacy Fortran scientific codes and modern C++ Kokkos performance-portable components, essential for modernizing HPC applications.

name: kokkos-kernels
one_line_profile: Performance portable math kernels (BLAS, Sparse, Graph) for Kokkos
detailed_description: A collection of high-performance mathematical kernels including dense BLAS, sparse linear algebra, and graph algorithms, optimized for various hardware backends supported by Kokkos.

name: kokkos-remote-spaces
one_line_profile: Distributed memory extension for Kokkos using PGAS concepts
detailed_description: Extends Kokkos with distributed memory capabilities, allowing for Partitioned Global Address Space (PGAS) semantics to manage data across nodes in HPC clusters.

name: kokkos-tools
one_line_profile: Profiling and debugging suite for the Kokkos ecosystem
detailed_description: A set of dynamic tools for profiling, debugging, and analyzing the performance of Kokkos-based scientific applications, helping developers optimize code for HPC architectures.

name: PyKokkos
one_line_profile: Performance portable parallel programming framework for Python
detailed_description: A Python framework that provides performance portability for scientific computing by leveraging Kokkos C++ backend, allowing Python users to write high-performance parallel code.

name: pykokkos-base
one_line_profile: Low-level Python bindings for Kokkos data structures

name: Butterfly
one_line_profile: Python API for creating and running OpenFOAM CFD cases
detailed_description: A library that serves as a Python interface to OpenFOAM, allowing users to generate, run, and manage Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations, often used in environmental design workflows.

name: LAMMPS
one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator

name: MATAR
one_line_profile: Portable dense and sparse data representation library for Kokkos
detailed_description: A C++ library developed at LANL to facilitate the creation of portable dense and sparse data structures, leveraging Kokkos to ensure performance across different HPC architectures.

detailed_description: A high-performance, scalable Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) solver designed for Direct Numerical Simulation (DNS) of fluid flow in porous media, supporting multi-architecture execution.

name: PROGRESS

detailed_description: A rapid O(N) electronic structure solver developed at LANL, utilizing graph-based recursive methods for quantum mechanical simulations of materials.

name: vpic-kokkos

detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the VPIC plasma physics simulation code, rewritten using Kokkos to run efficiently on various GPU and CPU architectures.

name: CRANE

name: EJML

detailed_description: A fast and easy-to-use linear algebra library written in Java, supporting dense, sparse, real, and complex matrices, widely used in scientific computing within the Java ecosystem.

name: libMesh

detailed_description: A C++ library for the numerical simulation of partial differential equations using adaptive finite element methods, providing mesh handling and parallel computing capabilities.

name: SUSA

detailed_description: A C++ framework designed for high-performance computing tasks and signal processing applications, providing optimized algorithms and structures.

name: LifeV

detailed_description: A C++ library for Finite Element simulations, focusing on multiphysics problems such as fluid-structure interaction and hemodynamics, developed by a consortium of research institutions.

name: CudaDMA

detailed_description: A C++ library that enables the emulation of Direct Memory Access (DMA) engines on CUDA-enabled GPUs, facilitating efficient data movement and performance portability in HPC applications.

name: madupite

detailed_description: A distributed solver for large-scale Markov Decision Processes (MDP) utilizing inexact policy iteration, designed for high performance on HPC systems.

name: ambit

detailed_description: A specialized solver built on FEniCSx for cardiovascular multi-physics simulations, including solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, and growth/remodeling models.

detailed_description: A C++ library that extends deal.II to support Isogeometric Analysis (IGA), enabling the use of NURBS and other spline-based basis functions for solving partial differential equations.

name: WaveBEM

detailed_description: A Boundary Element Method (BEM) solver designed for simulating unsteady nonlinear potential flows, specifically focused on ship-wave interactions in hydrodynamics.

name: deal2lkit

detailed_description: A utility library that provides additional tools and modules for the deal.II finite element library, facilitating the development of complex FEA solvers.

name: pi-BEM

detailed_description: A parallel implementation of the Boundary Element Method for solving partial differential equations, designed for high-performance computing environments.

name: pi-DoMUS

detailed_description: A parallel multiphysics solver built on top of the deal.II library, capable of handling coupled physical phenomena in engineering simulations.

name: short-crack-model

detailed_description: A specialized finite element model that incorporates crystal plasticity and phase-field modeling to simulate the geometry and propagation of short cracks in materials.

detailed_description: A finite element library built upon deal.II, PETSc, and Trilinos for modeling coupled mechano-chemical problems, such as battery mechanics or corrosion.

detailed_description: A library implementing BLAS (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) operations for very large dense and sparse matrices stored on SSDs, enabling out-of-core scientific computing.

name: FLARE

detailed_description: A plugin that provides LAMMPS pair styles for deploying NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials in large-scale molecular dynamics simulations.

name: Aither

name: Morpheus

detailed_description: A C++ library providing dynamic matrix types and algorithms for sparse matrix computations, designed to facilitate high-performance scientific computing.

name: YAKL

name: DDalphaAMG

name: PETSc-FEM

detailed_description: A general-purpose, parallel finite element program developed for solving multi-physics problems, leveraging the PETSc library for scalable numerical linear algebra.

name: Hybrid-Fortran

detailed_description: A framework/utility to accelerate Fortran scientific codes using CUDA, OpenACC, and OpenMP in a unified and performance-portable manner.

name: multiphenicsx

detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the easy prototyping and implementation of multiphysics problems within the FEniCSx finite element framework.

name: HybridQ

detailed_description: A highly extensible platform for simulating large-scale quantum circuits on various hardware architectures, supporting both noiseless and noisy simulations with HPC integration.

name: swSim

detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated finite difference solver for heterogeneous, anisotropic elastodynamic equations, specifically designed for ultrasonic Nondestructive Evaluation (NDE) simulations.

name: Baram

detailed_description: Baram is an open-source graphical user interface and platform designed to make Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) accessible. It wraps OpenFOAM solvers, providing a streamlined workflow for setting up, running, and analyzing simulations without deep command-line expertise.

name: volume_distribution

detailed_description: A Python library for generating point distributions within the volume of a 3D mesh. This is useful for particle initialization in simulations, procedural generation, and geometry processing tasks where volumetric sampling is required.

name: Phase

detailed_description: Phase is a C++ solver for simulating multiphase flows on unstructured grids. It employs immersed boundary methods to handle complex geometries and fluid-structure interactions, suitable for research in fluid dynamics.

name: petsc-hs

detailed_description: Provides Haskell bindings to the PETSc (Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation) and SLEPc libraries, enabling high-performance scientific computing and linear algebra operations within the Haskell programming environment.

name: sparse-linear-algebra
one_line_profile: Native Haskell library for sparse linear algebra computations
detailed_description: A pure Haskell library for numerical computation focusing on sparse linear algebra. It provides data structures and algorithms for handling sparse matrices, suitable for scientific applications requiring linear solvers in Haskell.

name: Maia

detailed_description: Maia is a Python library developed by ONERA for handling CGNS (CFD General Notation System) meshes in a massively parallel distributed environment. It provides tools for mesh partitioning, reordering, and data exchange in HPC workflows.

name: Paradigm
one_line_profile: Library for managing meshes in massively parallel environments
detailed_description: Paradigm is a C library from ONERA designed to manage mesh data structures in distributed memory environments. It facilitates the development of parallel solvers by handling mesh connectivity and data distribution.

name: cuda-multigrid
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated multigrid solver for Poisson's equation
detailed_description: A CUDA-based implementation of a geometric multigrid solver for the 2D Poisson equation. It leverages GPU acceleration to provide high-performance solutions for elliptic PDEs.

name: PyPartMC
one_line_profile: Python interface to the PartMC particle-resolved Monte Carlo model
detailed_description: PyPartMC provides Python bindings for PartMC, a particle-resolved Monte Carlo model for simulating atmospheric aerosol dynamics. It enables researchers to perform complex atmospheric simulations and analysis using Python ecosystems.

name: Owl ODE
one_line_profile: Differential equation solvers for the Owl scientific computing library
detailed_description: Owl ODE is a library providing a collection of Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) solvers for the Owl scientific computing ecosystem in OCaml. It supports various integration schemes for simulating dynamic systems.

name: AthenaPK

detailed_description: AthenaPK is a performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code. It is built on the Parthenon AMR framework and Kokkos, allowing it to run efficiently on diverse HPC architectures including GPUs.

name: Parthenon
one_line_profile: Performance portable adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) framework
detailed_description: Parthenon is a high-performance, portable Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) framework derived from Athena++. It serves as an infrastructure for building grid-based simulation codes that can run on CPUs and GPUs using Kokkos.

name: DOT
one_line_profile: Decomposed Optimization Time Integration for deformation dynamics
detailed_description: DOT (Decomposed Optimization Time Integration) is a simulation method and library for fast, reliable simulation of deformation dynamics. It uses domain-decomposed optimization to enable efficient convergence for frame-rate time-steps in graphics and mechanics simulations.

name: PERMON
one_line_profile: Parallel solvers for quadratic programming and SVMs based on PETSc
detailed_description: PERMON is a library for solving quadratic programming (QP) problems and support vector machines (SVMs), built on top of PETSc. It is designed for massive parallelism and includes solvers for contact problems in mechanics.

name: GeoSlicer
one_line_profile: Platform for digital rocks physics and micro-CT image analysis
detailed_description: GeoSlicer is an open-source platform for digital rock physics, enabling analysis of micro-CT, CT, and borehole images. It includes tools for segmentation, porosity/permeability analysis, and flow simulation in porous media.

name: PETSc
one_line_profile: Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation
detailed_description: PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations. It is a foundational library for HPC, providing linear and nonlinear solvers.

name: Phoebe
one_line_profile: Solver for phonon and electron Boltzmann transport equations
detailed_description: Phoebe is a high-performance C++ code for solving the Boltzmann transport equation for phonons and electrons. It is used to calculate transport properties like thermal conductivity and electron mobility in materials.

name: PISM
one_line_profile: Parallel Ice Sheet Model
detailed_description: PISM is an open-source, parallel, high-resolution ice sheet model. It is used to simulate the dynamics of ice sheets and glaciers for climate research and sea-level rise projections.

name: euler2d_kokkos
one_line_profile: Kokkos-based 2D Euler equation solver
detailed_description: A finite volume solver for the 2D Euler equations implemented using the Kokkos performance portability library. It serves as a reference implementation and benchmark for developing portable HPC fluid dynamics codes.

name: euler_kokkos
one_line_profile: Compressible hydro and MHD solver using MPI+Kokkos
detailed_description: A compressible hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing 2nd order Godunov schemes. It utilizes MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution across CPUs and GPUs, serving as a robust research code for HPC methods.

name: ppkMHD
one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos spectral difference method implementation
detailed_description: An implementation of high-order spectral difference methods (SDM) for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD), accelerated with MPI and Kokkos. It targets high-performance simulation on modern hardware architectures.

name: ramsesGPU
one_line_profile: GPU-optimized astrophysics MHD simulation code
detailed_description: An astrophysics Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulation code optimized for large GPU clusters. It is designed to perform high-resolution simulations of astrophysical phenomena using massive parallelism.

name: s-blas

detailed_description: A library implementing sparse linear algebra kernels (SpMV, SpTRSV, SpTrans, SpMM) optimized for single-node multi-GPU platforms like NVIDIA DGX, developed by PNNL.

name: polysolve
one_line_profile: Wrapper library for various linear and non-linear solvers
detailed_description: A C++ library that provides a unified interface to various linear and non-linear solvers, designed to be easy to use within finite element applications like PolyFEM.

name: fenicsx-adapter
one_line_profile: Adapter to couple FEniCSx solvers with preCICE
detailed_description: An adapter enabling the integration of FEniCSx-based solvers into partitioned multi-physics simulations managed by the preCICE coupling library.

name: PyAMG
one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers in Python
detailed_description: A library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for solving large sparse linear systems, commonly arising in solving partial differential equations.

name: sunode
one_line_profile: Fast ODE solver with PyMC support
detailed_description: A Python library for solving Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) efficiently, with specific support for derivatives required by probabilistic programming in PyMC.

name: python-graphblas
one_line_profile: Python library for GraphBLAS sparse linear algebra
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the GraphBLAS standard, providing high-performance sparse linear algebra primitives often used in graph analytics and scientific computing.

name: trng4
one_line_profile: Parallel pseudo-random number generator library for Monte Carlo
detailed_description: A state-of-the-art C++ library for generating pseudo-random numbers, specifically designed for sequential and parallel Monte Carlo simulations.

name: raptor
one_line_profile: High performance algebraic multigrid solver
detailed_description: A general-purpose, high-performance Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solver library written in C++.

name: P3DFFT++
one_line_profile: Parallel 3D Fast Fourier Transform library for multiscale simulations
detailed_description: P3DFFT++ is a high-performance library for computing parallel Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT) in three dimensions. It is designed for simulating multiscale phenomena and supports 1D, 2D, and 3D domain decomposition using MPI. It serves as a core component for spectral methods in CFD and materials science.

name: PSBLAS
one_line_profile: Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms library
detailed_description: PSBLAS (Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) is a library that implements sparse linear algebra operations on distributed memory parallel computers. It provides a framework for iterative solvers and preconditioners, essential for large-scale scientific simulations.

name: SimGrid
one_line_profile: Framework for simulation of distributed computer systems (Cloud, HPC, Grid)
detailed_description: SimGrid is a scientific instrument for studying the behavior of large-scale distributed systems such as Grids, Clouds, HPC clusters, and Fog Computing. It allows researchers to simulate algorithms and applications to evaluate performance and correctness.

name: cudaParticlesFoam
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated particle tracking extension for OpenFOAM
detailed_description: cudaParticlesFoam is a library that provides GPU acceleration for Lagrangian particle tracking within the OpenFOAM CFD toolbox. It offloads particle calculations to CUDA-enabled GPUs, significantly speeding up multiphase flow simulations.

name: sprs
one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra library for Rust
detailed_description: sprs is a library for sparse matrix computations in Rust. It provides data structures and algorithms for sparse linear algebra, which are fundamental for implementing scientific solvers and simulations in the Rust ecosystem.

name: SPARTA
one_line_profile: Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) code for rarefied gas dynamics
detailed_description: SPARTA is a parallel DSMC code for simulating low-density gases. It is designed to run efficiently on large-scale parallel computers and is used for modeling rarefied gas flows, such as spacecraft re-entry or vacuum systems.

name: SPECTER
one_line_profile: High-order PDE solver using Fourier Continuation methods
detailed_description: SPECTER is a PDE solver focused on Navier-Stokes and related equations. It employs Fourier Continuation (FC-Gram) expansions to handle arbitrary boundary conditions with high accuracy and is parallelized using MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA.

name: SPH-EXA
one_line_profile: Parallel SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) simulation code
detailed_description: SPH-EXA is a C++20 simulation framework for performing hydrodynamics simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It is optimized for modern HPC architectures, supporting MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP for massive parallelism.

name: SST Elements
one_line_profile: Component library for the Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST)
detailed_description: SST Elements provides a collection of simulation components (processors, memory, network) for the Structural Simulation Toolkit. It is used to simulate and evaluate the performance of future high-performance computing architectures.

name: Stan Math Library
one_line_profile: C++ template library for automatic differentiation and probabilistic modeling
detailed_description: The Stan Math Library provides robust, high-performance automatic differentiation (forward, reverse, and mixed modes) and a comprehensive set of mathematical functions. It is the computational engine behind the Stan probabilistic programming language, widely used for Bayesian inference and statistical modeling.

name: Sundial
one_line_profile: Foundation model for time series analysis
detailed_description: Sundial is a family of highly capable foundation models designed for time series analysis. It provides pre-trained models for tasks such as forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection across various scientific and industrial domains.

name: ForTrilinos
one_line_profile: Object-oriented Fortran interfaces to Trilinos C++ packages
detailed_description: Provides portable, object-oriented Fortran interfaces to the Trilinos C++ scientific software libraries, enabling Fortran-based HPC applications to leverage Trilinos solvers.

name: Trilinos
one_line_profile: Collection of open-source software libraries for scientific applications
detailed_description: A massive collection of reusable scientific software libraries, known as packages, designed for the solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and scientific problems.

name: trotter-suzuki-mpi
one_line_profile: Massively Parallel Trotter-Suzuki Solver for quantum simulations
detailed_description: A massively parallel implementation of the Trotter-Suzuki decomposition method for solving quantum spin systems and other matrix exponentiation problems.

name: JAXFLUIDS
one_line_profile: Differentiable Fluid Dynamics Package using JAX
detailed_description: A fully differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solver written in Python using JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and machine learning integration for fluid problems.

name: quagmire
one_line_profile: Surface process framework on unstructured meshes
detailed_description: A Python framework for modeling surface processes (erosion, transport) on highly scalable unstructured meshes, part of the Underworld geodynamics ecosystem.

name: underworld2
one_line_profile: Parallel PIC-FEM code for Geodynamics
detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations, allowing for the modeling of complex fluid flows in the Earth's mantle and lithosphere.

name: vistle
one_line_profile: High-Performance Simulation and Parallel Visualization Environment
detailed_description: A software environment designed for high-performance simulation and parallel visualization, supporting distributed data processing and rendering on HPC clusters.

name: waiwera
one_line_profile: Parallel geothermal flow simulator
detailed_description: A parallel, open-source simulator for geothermal flow, heat transport, and solute transport in porous media, designed for geothermal reservoir modeling.

name: WfCommons
one_line_profile: Framework for Enabling Scientific Workflow Research
detailed_description: A framework for generating synthetic scientific workflow traces and instances to support research and development of scientific workflow management systems.

name: TopADD_2D_3D_Arbitrary_TopOpt_in_PETSc
one_line_profile: Parallel topology optimization framework for arbitrary domains
detailed_description: A 2D/3D integrated topology optimization parallel-computing framework capable of handling arbitrary design domains using PETSc.

name: wrench
one_line_profile: Cyberinfrastructure Simulation Workbench
detailed_description: A simulation framework for building simulators of distributed computing platforms (clouds, grids, clusters) to study scientific workflow execution and resource management.

name: navier_stokes_multigrid
one_line_profile: 3D Navier-Stokes solver using pressure-correction and parallel multigrid
detailed_description: A C++ implementation of a 3D Navier-Stokes equation solver utilizing a pressure-correction scheme and parallel multigrid v-cycle for efficient fluid dynamics simulation.

name: libyt
one_line_profile: C++ library for in-situ analysis and visualization connecting simulations with yt
detailed_description: A library that enables in-situ analysis and visualization for simulations written in C/C++ by bridging them with the Python-based 'yt' analysis toolkit, allowing researchers to analyze data during simulation runtime.

name: turbulent-cfd
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated turbulent CFD solver using CUDA and Vulkan
detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver capable of handling turbulence, optimized for performance on CPUs and GPUs using CUDA and Vulkan APIs.

name: pystella
one_line_profile: Code generator for grid-based PDE solving on CPUs and GPUs
detailed_description: A Python-based code generator designed to automate the creation of high-performance code for solving grid-based Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) on both CPU and GPU architectures.

name: zpc
one_line_profile: Parallel computing library designed for physics-based simulations
detailed_description: The Zenus Parallel Computing (ZPC) library provides infrastructure for developing high-performance, physics-based simulations, focusing on parallel execution capabilities.

name: fdtd3d
one_line_profile: High-performance FDTD electromagnetics solver with MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA support
detailed_description: An open-source Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) solver for electromagnetics, supporting 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations with parallel acceleration via MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA across multiple architectures.
